result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Robert J Grundman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Deferred Prosecution Agreement - count 1 for 1 year
State acknowledges that defendant now resides in Minnesota and cannot be subject to Wisconsin probation
The defendant shall not engage in any conduct which would lead an impartial magistrate to find probable cause exists to believe that the defendant has committed a violation of the criminal laws of the United States or the State of Wisconsin or of any ordinances adopting the same.
Within 30 days of agreement - initiate contact with a facility to commence counseling.
Have no direct or indirect contact with Kara Grundman or enter/remain upon any premises he has cause to believe said person may be present
Any contact with Attorney Luaders will be limited to necessary correspondence on current legal matters (mail only with no threatening language)
Pay victim witness surcharge of $92.00
Within 5 days after first contact with any provider, execute any and all written releases 
File a monthly written report certifying compliance
Provide Waupaca Co. DA's office with all necessary written proof of full compliance with this agreement
If complies - count 1 dismissed
Non-compliance - formal sentencing
Bond continued
